name: Home Saigon Restaurant
address: 185/28 Đ. Phạm Ngũ Lão, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: The food was quite good. Delicious with reasonable price. The waitress who named Blink can speak fluent English and her service is professional. We enjoyed our time there. Would definitely go again!

I had an amazing dining experience at Home Saigon! Four of us ate here, and every dish was delicious and beautifully presented. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it a perfect spot to enjoy authentic Vietnamese cuisine.

Our server, Tom, was fantastic—attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. I have a peanut allergy, and he went above and beyond to ensure I had safe and equally delicious options, offering great suggestions and double-checking with the kitchen. It made such a difference to feel so accommodated and cared for.

Highly recommend this place for both the food and the excellent service. If you’re in Ho Chi Minh City, Home Saigon is a must-visit!

Home Saigon is definitely worth trying. The spring rolls were crispy, the grilled chicken with coconut rice was juicy and tender, and the pan-seared buffalo with flaming cointreau liqueur was rich, smoky, and perfectly seasoned. Both the service and atmosphere were also excellent.

search_results.formatted_address: 185/28 Đ. Phạm Ngũ Lão, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 185/28 Đ. Phạm Ngũ Lão

name: Propaganda Vietnamese Bistro
address: 21 Hàn Thuyên, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Just excellent. Staff were great, not over-friendly, efficient, smiling but then let you get on with your evening. Menu was rolls, rice, soup, noodles and some roast meats, not extensive but certainly wide enough. Drinks selection decent. Presentation/visuals excellent (food and decor), prices very reasonable. Location reasonably central. Very much approved

Food is pretty decent - a tad of a modern Vietnamese. Try their crispy rice and propaganda salad. Place fills up quickly in the evening. Largely expat crowd. Price point is good for the quality of food. Super chill atmosphere.  Recommended

Great flavours in a bustling, air-conditioned environment. Had the roast chicken with broken rice alongside fried fishcake, and both were great. Reasonable prices and excellent service too. This is the place to go after wandering about the city centre. The absence of hordes of bus-ferried tour groups here is an amazing plus too. Come here before that changes.

search_results.formatted_address: 21 Đ. Hàn Thuyên, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 21 Đ. Hàn Thuyên

name: Secret Garden Restaurant
address: 158 Pasteur, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Secret Garden is a hidden gem in the heart of Saigon that combines traditional Vietnamese charm with a serene rooftop dining experience. Nestled above the bustling streets, the restaurant offers a peaceful escape and an authentic culinary journey.

The ambiance is enchanting, with lanterns, lush greenery, and rustic decor that create a cozy, intimate setting. It truly feels like dining in a charming Vietnamese garden. The rooftop view, though not expansive, provides a unique perspective of the city, especially during the evening when the lights come alive.

The food is the highlight of the experience. Every dish we tried was bursting with authentic flavors and made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. Their clay pot dishes, spring rolls, and banana flower salad were particularly outstanding. The presentation was thoughtful, and the portions were generous.

The staff was warm, attentive, and eager to recommend dishes to suit our tastes. Their genuine hospitality made the experience even more memorable.

Secret Garden is perfect for anyone looking to savor traditional Vietnamese cuisine in a tranquil and aesthetically pleasing setting. Whether you're a tourist exploring the city or a local seeking a special dining spot, this rooftop restaurant is a must-visit. We will definitely be back!

The restaurant is quite well hidden and needs to climb 4 levels to reach. But once you reach, it’s a food paradise with pretty lanterns and vibes. We ordered 2 gin-based cocktails - Ms Saigon and Saigon Summer, which are both great, esp Ms Saigon love it. Food wise everything we ordered was delicious and homely, especially love the eggplant and braised chicken with lime leaves. Will definitely come back again in the future when we visit HCMC.

The ambiance is pleasant, but the place is clearly geared toward tourists. The food was okay not bad, but not what you’d really hope for when dining in Vietnam. It felt more like being in a gentrified European city than in Saigon. Overall, not a terrible experience, but there are definitely better and more authentic places to eat in the city.

search_results.name: 158 Pasteur

name: Bep Me In - Nguyen Thai Binh
address: 165/50 Đ. Nguyễn Thái Bình, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: This was the best tasting food that I've eaten at during my trip to Vietnam.  I liked it so much that I came back 2 other times, and brought a friend the second time.  My first experience at this place, I ordered the Beef Skewers with Rice Vermicelli and an order Fried Spring Rolls and Pickled Plum Juice.  These were all recommended by my waiter, and I gave everything a 10/10, and the portions were huge and I completely devoured it.  The second time I ordered the recommended Stir-Fried Beef Fillet with Beef Sauce and Vegetable and Salted Lemon Drink and didn't like it as much, as it didn't taste as good and the portion was a lot smaller.  The waiter also forgot the Spring rolls we ordered.  The place seems to have a lot of foreigners (which is often a red flag for me), and it does seem a bit commercial (it is a franchise), so I questioned its authenticity as Vietnamese cuisine.  However, despite all this, I still highly recommend this place as it's still my go-to when I want a full hearty and tasty meal that seems reasonably authentic.  It also seems like a good place to bring a date.

The service was fast. Although poor signal for card payment but the servers were always smiling and polite.

Food was served fast and hot. We love the skewers and pancakes. Really filling to the tummy. The servings were really good for sharing.

The ambiance is very soothing to the mood.

Our hotel recommended this place for food & I am so happy they did. The food was so delicious. They had meat options & vegetarian. I really enjoyed my milk coffee too. You can tell a lot of effort has been made into the quality of the service & the food. Get yourself down here you won't be disappointed!

search_results.formatted_address: 165/50 Đ. Nguyễn Thái Bình, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 165/50 Đ. Nguyễn Thái Bình

name: Bếp Mẹ Ỉn - Vietnamese Restaurant
address: 136/9 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Really good food. There were so many good options on the menu I’d have to come back 5-6 times just to do a review justice! With my one visit I can tell you the food is excellently cooked, authentic, appropriately priced and offered with good service. The snacks and meat plates are decidedly better than the noodle based dishes but I’m splitting hairs.

Went for dinner on a Sunday night. It was busy, recommend a res. I was seated quickly. The staff are friendly and helpful but inattentive. I ordered the pork and shrimp banh xeo. It's large and amply filled. There were only a few pieces of shrimp, however. It tasted great. I wasn't given cutlery, and the napkin holder was empty. I tried to get the server's attention but gave up. The adjoining table hunted down napkins, which instigated a panic among the staff. Eventually, someone brought me a knife to cut the banh xeo. May return to try other menu items. Paid with a card. They don't accept AmEx.

베트남에서 제일 맛있었던 식당

The skewer from this place was the best thing I’ve ever tasted during my 3 months stay in Vietnam! It was so good that I had to go back again right before I left. The price is on a more expensive side, especially for a Vietnamese restaurant here, but I would definitely recommend this place if you don’t mind spending around 10 dollars for the skewers and a drink! This place is very famous for tourists and is always crowded, but I didn’t have to wait at all both times I visited.

search_results.formatted_address: 136-9D Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 136-9D Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn

name: Poke Saigon
address: Second floor, 42 Nguyễn Huệ, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Poké Saigon is an absolute gem! Their poke bowls are amazing—super fresh, packed with flavour, and loaded with a wide variety of ingredients to choose from. Whether you prefer classic salmon or something more adventurous, there’s something for everyone. The portions are generous, and the prices are surprisingly affordable for the quality you get.

The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming, making the experience even better. The atmosphere is lovely, with a relaxed and modern vibe that’s perfect for a quick lunch or a casual dinner. If you’re in Saigon and craving something fresh and delicious, this is definitely the place to go!

Came here after a long bus journey and the bowl was super good. There was a large selection of toppings and poke. The servers were also super sweet and helpful when deciding what to get and checking up on us. Overall super delicious and a large portion too

I’d recommend their vegetarian poke bowl & chocolate mousse😋😋, I’m so glad my friend introduced me to this place definitely gonna keep ordering more in the future. Everything was genuinely great from customer service/atmosphere to food. After eating I felt so full so for the price it was worth it. I love how u can customize ur own poke bowl and the ladies were so sweet and friendly 🫶🏻

Their house made sauces are irresistible & fantastic job done on their vegetarian/vegan version of tuna prolly outdid normal tuna at this point.

name: Cyclo Resto
address: 133 Đ. Nguyễn Du, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.text: Our tour guide Khang brought us to this wonderful restaurant for lunch. Everything was delicious, especially the fish dish. After lunch we had the egg coffee. Another delicious surprise.  Our server was darling and spoke perfect English. A great experience all around ❤️
Vi is excellent hostess. The food was amazing and the hospitality so friendly. Thank you for the best lunch we have had in Vietnam. Those stuffed courgette tempura are 11/10.

Great hidden gem. The kid that took our order was very sassy but his English was pretty good. He was a funny guy. The pork skewers were amazing. I would go back for them. The dishes portions were a little small for me. But it's a good place for a snack. Good tasting meals.

search_results.formatted_address: 133 Đ. Nguyễn Du, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 133 Đ. Nguyễn Du

name: Quan Bui - Original
address: 19 Ngô Văn Năm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Everything we ordered hit the table like a flavor bomb—bold, amazing flavors in every bite! The Vietnamese prawn pancakes were the only miss here (not recommended), too bland compared to everything else we tried. Still, we were too hooked on the standout dishes to mind much.

Our waitress was a champ, patient and on point with our big group. The jasmine IPA from a local brewery was sensational. Highly recommend this spot! 😍👌🏼

Very nice place with cool atmosphere! Has a first floor with a balcony where you can eat didn’t see that! The fried half chicken was nothing special just as you expect fried chicken with not much seasoning. The beef with vegetables and the fried rice with garlic and egg were delicious! Not sure if worth the price we paid here. They have 5% service charge and 8% VAT too. Good overall but won’t come back. Other places much better!

This restaurant is an experience in many ways. Every dish we ordered was full of amazing flavours and we paired them with fresh juices. The restaurant creates a special vibe and atmosphere with love to details. Must go to place for an authentic Vietnamese food experience.

search_results.formatted_address: 19 Đ. Ng. Văn Năm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 19 Đ. Ng. Văn Năm

name: Hoa Túc Saigon
address: 74/7 Hai Bà Trưng, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Probably the best fancy-style restaurant I’ve been to in Ho Chi Minh, the food was really good and plenty of standout options. Loads on the menu I’d come back for. Service was a little slow but it was very busy. The prices were quite high for the City but not high for the quality of what you get. I’d highly recommend the mini-pancakes with oysters (so much better than the huge pancakes you get in other Michelin places in the city). The soft-shell crabs were the best I’ve had, the legs come off perfectly and the dipping sauce is excellent. The netted spring rolls, pineapple rice were quite average. The chicken was top notch.

The food was good but definitely a lot more expensive than other places in HCM. You are paying for the ambiance, service and that they’re Michelin recommended. We tried the dishes recommended on the site and they were good. Nothing to die for. They provide a bowl of shrimp crackers as a light snack when you sit down. The most surprising thing is their egg coffee. We weren’t expecting anything too special and didn’t take a photo. Hands down the best one we had in town!

This is absolutely a delight and it made my day by their very well trained and well mannered staff. We ordered quite a few contemporary Vietnam dishes with non traditional but authentic flavors. I like the soft-shell crab and the taco like appetizer. The pork neck meat and the lemon grass chicken are really special. Price is also very reasonable with a Michelin label.   I certainly will bring my wife back here next time in town. P.S. a meal won’t be complete without a good dessert and coffee. For that, egg coffee is a must!

name: Ngon Restaurant
address: 160 Pasteur, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Apr 2025: great ambience and lovely place for a mid size group gathering. Wide selection of food within the menu for all tastes and preferences. We had the steak and fries + crab meat vermicelli dish. Both were v good. Of mention is the bun that came with the steak. Crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Wonderful!

Vietnamese food attracts both local and tourist. No air-conditioning but it’s cool indoor at evening during April. The food is good and delicious, also value for money. The grilled chicken is a must eat item, we ordered same dish 2 evenings.

Disappointing restaurant. Looks charming and filled with tourists. But service staff is rude and rushed. Food is really mediocre. Can you imagine a dish with French fries added to prawns pancake? And fried squid that tasted like fried eraser - good hard work for the jaws. Menu is super extensive… too extensive. Maybe they should focus on getting a few dishes done really well instead

search_results.name: 160 Pasteur

name: Le Corto
address: 5D Đ. Nguyễn Siêu, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
100% recommended - super good value for money for the quality and immaculate service!

the meal started really strong with the complimentary amuse bouche (sea bass shisho broth, parmesan crackers and raspberry rolls), which were all delicious. this was followed by a delightful bread selection of sourdough, baguette and my favourite of the lot, the brioche, which was warm, fluffy and studded with olives!!!!! two types of butter served (chilli and normal) but nothing to write home about, but no issue cus the bread held its own!

for starters, we had the escargot and foie gras. unfortunately i felt the garlic butter for the escargots was a bit too pungent and sharp and the taste fell a bit flat. foie gras was also a tad dry

for mains, the duck breast was soft and juicy and the skin was perfectly roasted and glistening. we also had the beef wellie which slapped! altho it is not a traditional french dish, it was so good - puff pastry was buttery and flaky, the beef was tender and well seasoned, and the diced mushrooms also added another dimension to the flavour!

all in all a very good meal

I had lunch with my family of 5 here and it was incredible! My family and I have actually never had French food before, but we were feeling adventurous.

We had the mackerel as an appetizer and chose the a la carte duck breast for the entree, which was the best duck we had ever tasted. Chef Sakal explained to us how the ducks came from the Mekong Delta and how they were dry aged and roasted. The duck skin was crispy like Peking duck, but the meat was incredibly tender and juicy. It is a must-order dish. We also tried the escargot which was seasoned perfectly and very enjoyable with the garlic and sourdough bread. My boyfriend has a previous bad experience with escargot at another restaurant but the escargot at Le Corto completely changed his attitude towards the dish. Finally, we had crepes (which were lit on fire!) with coconut ice cream and a dessert box with delicious truffles and small pastries. I think it is so rare to find a restaurant that excels in both entrees and desserts, but this one did!

The ambiance of the restaurant was so cozy but also very elegant. As an American, I noticed that many French restaurants in the USA seem very pretentious and stuffy, so their cuisine is often inaccessible to many people. At Le Corto, the waitstaff and Chef Sakal treat their patrons like family while still providing a classy and high quality experience. This restaurant is truly a gem in Saigon and I would not hesitate to eat here with my family again. I would eat at any restaurant of Chef Sakal's in Vietnam!

I had a very good time there enjoying French mixed Vietnamese cuisine.
Some traditional and some with SEA elements.
Apparently the owner/chef had good relationships with several iconic Michelin chefs who had been to Le Corto as guest chefs.
The staff were friendly and helpful, food came at the right time, not too fast or slow, just one by one.
Highly recommend foie gras and baked mango with coconut ice cream.

search_results.formatted_address: 5D Đ. Nguyễn Siêu, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 5D Đ. Nguyễn Siêu

name: Vị Quê Kitchen
address: 110 Sương Nguyệt Anh, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
I've been to this restaurant twice.  Their service is excellent. The atmosphere is very nice and very clean. The food I had a mixed experience. The spring rolls were decent,  and the grilled eggplant was excellent and yummy.  However, the q Fried Rice was pretty bland and didn't really appeal to me too much.  And the tea was average as well.

overall, I would say that this place is worth another shot for me. I do think there's a lot of promise and potential here. The service is excellent, like I said before, and they also have a Michelin rating, apparently which obviously they feature prominently on their menu and outside. I think it's pretty good overall.    The prices are fair, although it may seem that it's a bit on the higher side relative to other places, but the quality of their food is on the higher side. I just need to find the dishes that taste good for me and are not bland.

This was truly an amazing experience. Together with my wife we admitted that this was the best vegetarian food we've ever tasted in our lives. The cooks are experts when it's about working with shrooms. The peanut shroom soup and the shittake tartar were truly astonishing. Everything is served in a eye-pleasing way. The service is nice and responsive. The variety of dishes is wide. The place itself is quite elegant, but the floor could be actually renovated a bit. I know I haven't seen bigger part of the city, but still this is the restaurant no. 1 I will recommend when someone asks me about food in HMC. And still, it's quite affordable in my opinion

Really great place to enjoy a special vegetarian/vegan meal while also having authentic Vietnam flavors! I recommend this place without hesitation: Outstanding food, nice dining atmosphere and great service. We thought this place was so great that we wanted to have one more meal here: When we had a layover in HCMC, we stored our luggage at the airport, took a Grab from the airport into the city, had a great dinner and went back to catch our flight home. Really good value for money!

search_results.formatted_address: 110 Sương Nguyệt Anh, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 110 Sương Nguyệt Anh

name: Vo Roof
address: 113 Tôn Thất Đạm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
First time to Vietnam and wanted somewhere safe to try some local dishes and Vo did not disappoint!
Staff were great, and the food was absolutely delicious. A really great intro into traditional Vietnamese food and at a very great price. We had an entire table full of food and drinks for less than AUD$30. Atmosphere was nice, good decor etc. easy to find.

4.5/5

I had an amazing experience at Vo Roof in Ho Chi Minh! The bar had an upper deck with open seating, where the atmosphere was much more lively and fun. The staff were friendly and attentive, and the cocktails were creative and delicious. My family and I enjoyed the food, which was both, authentic and truly delicious. My only minor complaint was that the var restaurant is a little crammed for space, and can get pretty crowded very fast, but overall, Vo Roof was an unforgettable experience.

Staff were patient and gave recommendations that were lovely. Enjoyed the beef pho, bun kho (with beef) and stir fried oyster mushrooms. There’s a variety of local spirits at the bar and good non-alcoholic options too! *For vegetarians, there’s a large selection here!

name: Carpaccio - Authentic Italian Restaurant
address: 79 Hai Bà Trưng, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Nice restaurant, a small piece of Italy in HCMC. All dishes served were delicious. Perfect steak, soups and pasta were perfect. Prices are reasonable. Authentic atmosphere of Italy with pictures of old Italy on the brick walls. Very clean and cozy. Waiters are courteous.

I just had one of the most delightful Italian dining experiences in Ho Chi Minh City! The pizza I tried was absolutely fantastic—perfectly baked with a crispy crust and a harmony of flavors that took me straight to Italy. And now, as I’m enjoying their pasta, I’m equally amazed. The taste is simply fascinating—each bite feels like a masterpiece crafted with love and authentic Italian flair.

The ambiance is cozy, the staff is friendly, and you can feel the passion they put into every dish. If you’re craving Italian cuisine that truly impresses, this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

Conveniently situated on a pedestrian route, this space is delightful. Here, my friends and I enjoyed a very blending dinner. In more detail, the staffs are really nice. Their demeanor, which caring about the space that we can enjoy. Everything was fantastic! I will definitely return here.

search_results.name: 79 Hai Bà Trưng

name: Bếp Ốc Sài Gòn
open_status: Seafood entrees in a casual setting
address: 74/7 Hai Bà Trưng, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 71000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Great spot to get snails in district 1 that's not street food.

I came here with a friend to get some good sea food and it did not disappoint. We ordered sea food foil, lemon grass clams, and vitate conchs.

Sea food foil was great to share between friends, a good amount of sea food and mushrooms in it.

Lemon grass clams were also well made, good flavor and cooked excellently. It is though a small amount.

The vitate conchs we ordered were good to me but my Viet friend said that these snails were more like french snails, so if you are not fond of those types of snails you may want to avoid these types.

Also important to mention that the prices here are very expensive for what you get compared to street food, so if you're willing to pay the price it's good but otherwise go for street food.

A great seafood spot with fresh ingredients and friendly staff. The raw oysters were my favorite, and I appreciated how the server thoughtfully prepared the perfect dipping sauce. The razor clams with tamarind sauce were excellent. I was also amazed by how the sea urchin tasted. truly a memorable experience worth recommending.

I was particularly impressed with the restaurant's location. At first, I thought it might be a bit noisy and crowded since it's in District 1, but when I arrived, I had an incredibly relaxing evening.

The food was delicious, and the space was open and airy. The dishes were uniquely flavoured, with minimal oil, well-portioned servings, and large-sized snails. The prices were reasonable for a restaurant in the city center, and the staff was polite and friendly.

search_results.formatted_address: 74/7 Hai Bà Trưng, P. Phú Thuận, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 74/7 Hai Bà Trưng

name: Baba's Kitchen Indian Restaurant D1
address: 274 Đ. Bùi Viện, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
I’ve tried Baba's Indian restaurants and this has been the best so far in my list. The food is amazing, service is exceptional. They even gave us Pappad and some indian side dishes while we waiting the food.

Highly recommend butter chicken,butter Nan,mutton biriyani and Indian Special sets which you can try little of everything. Food we ordered good for two people.

Will definitely come back and recommend to my friends💯

This Indian restaurant is located at

274 Bùi Viện, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam.

Since it was highly rated we chose to visit the place and taste their food. it was a very good experience. Out and out a hearty Indian meal. They also have south Indian dishes on the menu.

The place is small with ground level and first level sitting arrangements.

Darwin was our server and took utmost care of our needs. Hello was watchful, quick and very courteous in his service.

I’ve tried 4-5 Indian restaurants and this has been the best so far in my list. The food is amazing, service is exceptional that I even feel my table has our own server. They even gave us Gobi Manchurian while we waiting the food.

Highly recommend butter chicken and Indian Special sets which you can try little of everything. Food we ordered good for two people.

Will definitely come back and recommend to my friends💯

search_results.name: 274 Đ. Bùi Viện

name: Cloud Nine Restaurant Sai Gon
address: 180-188 Lý Tự Trọng, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: My colleagues and I spent the week in south Vietnam and decided to have a nice farewell dinner. We chose Cloud Nine and were so glad we did. The food was amazing, some of the best I have ever had. The presentation was equally as wonderful. The service of the staff was an A+ and the view of the city was great. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting HCMC.  Bravo!

We were so happy with this wonderful little restaurant- service & food were exceptional. We celebrated my husbands 70th birthday here ( tourists from Australia) The staff were so happy to be involved & helped make our evening really special . Our food was yummy , served with theatrical presentation & delicious . It’s was a very special evening & we were so happy we chose Cloud Nine - the staff made us all feel special ,especially my husband . A great night we have wonderful memories. Highly recommend this restaurant!!

We had a wonderful time at the Cloud nine restaurant. Indeed, we came to stay a few days for our honeymoon, and Mrs. Nhung was adorable and made this moment, an unforgettable moment filled with small attentions. Mr Triong behind the bar made us taste delicious cocktails, including one especially to celebrate our honeymoon. Very kind and attentive, I recommend it!

name: A Taste Of Saigon - Old Market
address: 42/6B Đ. Tôn Thất Thiệp, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: What an awesome restaurant, while we were walking around this area’s restaurant, we suddenly got hungry and started looking at google maps reviews, this one instantaneously caught our eyes for their reviews and 4.9 star rating. After coming here it didn’t disappoint at all! We ate the food that I have uploaded in my reviews and it was absolute stunning, delicious and ate it pretty fast! Lyly was of great assistant as well, we appreciate her help recommending dishes. Truly recommended😊

A delicious meal which our group thoroughly enjoyed. Kim, who served us was great. She was very attentive and showed us how to wrap the rice paper rolls. The food was superb and we will recommend this lovely restaurant to any friends visiting this vibrant city.

Great place!!!! The food was amazing. The staff was very polite and helpful. Kim the waitress that served as has excellent, very polite and assist us by explaining the dishes and even show us how to eat some of them.  It's a little bit difficult to find the restaurant, there is an alley between two clubs (you will noticed parked motorcycle inside the alley) at the end of the alley go left and you will see the entrance.

search_results.formatted_address: 42/6B Đ. Tôn Thất Thiệp, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 42/6B Đ. Tôn Thất Thiệp

name: Tung's Restaurant - Vietnamese Cuisine & vegetarian Food
address: 230 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: Food was probably the best we had while we were in Vietnam! It was all so fresh and tasty. The staff were lovely and friendly and also spoke amazing English. I had the chicken pho which was unreal. Other people had the stir fried noodles as well as the sweet and sour chicken, which were super delicious. We also had a few cocktails which were so nice a refreshing. Would definitely recommend!

The food, the service and atmosphere were amazing. KT team was very helpful we ordered the Mekong delta pancake and had no idea how to put it together and they demonstrated for us. Our waiter spoke perfect English which made everything super easy. If ever in Vietnam again I will definitely be back
The waiter Dom Team was excellent, he was so polite and friendly. The food was alright and nothing special but good presentation. I like this place because everyone can speak English.

search_results.formatted_address: 230 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 230 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn

plus_code.compound_code: QMFW+2H District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

name: Hoang’s Kitchen -Vietnamese cuisine & Vegan food
address: 45 Thủ Khoa Huân, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: Hoang’s Kitchen is one of the best Vietnamese food we’ve eaten during this trip. I travelled with my mom and aunts who are quite particular with food taste and these passed their taste with flying colours. Their service was good as well. Our server, Ruby was very attentive and addressed all our needs. Will definitely come back to Hoang’s when I visit Vietnam again❤️

Saw this place highly rated on TripAdvisor with over 6000 reviews, so thought we’d give it a shot. Food was tasty, fresh & plentiful. Daisy was our waitress, and was pleasant & helpful. The restaurant was packed on a Friday night, yet still managed to get the meals out in a timely manner.

Note, they do tend to ask you to rate them (on the spot) by scanning a QR code on your phone for their restaurant, right after your meal when paying. So probably accounts for how many actual reviews they get, & positive ones. With people feeling a tad pressured to say something nice about the food ,or the service. Not something we generally like, but as said this time, the food & service did justify a positive review.

I stumbled upon Hoang’s Kitchen and it turned out to be one of my favorite food spots in the city! I ordered the fresh rolls and the incredibly soft grilled pork with quail eggs — both recommended by Bear, one of the friendliest and most helpful staff I’ve met on my trip. The flavors were bold, fresh, and perfectly balanced. The grilled pork was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and paired with the quail eggs, it hit all the right notes.

Bear really went above and beyond to make sure I had the best experience — from helping with the order to making great suggestions. It’s the kind of place that feels warm, local, and authentic.

Highly recommend if you’re in Saigon and craving something genuinely good and comforting!

search_results.formatted_address: 45 Thủ Khoa Huân, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 45 Thủ Khoa Huân

name: The Monkey Gallery DINING
address: 3rd Floor, 91 Mạc Thị Bưởi, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Outstanding Vietnamese fusion restaurant.  Cozy, modern decor.  Food is prepared right in front of you.  This menu was based on colors: 9 colors represented by 9 courses.  Food presentation, preparation, and originality were amazing!  You are treated to totally off-the-beaten-track surprises like ostrich meat, snail, lobster, raw scallop, crème brulee tea, etc.  Staff is top-notch and service was as good as it gets.  The only disappointment is that as of now there’s no wine pairing available (you can order wine by glass or bottle).

I stumbled on this restaurant looking for a New Year meal and it was a very nice surprise. I chose the Stylish menu and the dishes featuring Vietnamese ingredients. It really struck me how fresh, yet familiar, the flavours felt. There was one off-menu item: the black bread and white sauce featuring bacon,  manchego cheese, truffles and others if I can remember a few of the ingredients... That was also wipe the bowl clean delicious so the chef really knows how to use Asian and western flavours well. The service level is of a very high calibre and I didn't have to wait long between courses. I'm really glad there are Vietnamese chefs taking the cuisine to new directions, it can only get better from here!

This is a MUST visit in Ho Chi Minh!!! The food was beyond delicious. The presentation is phenomenal. Tommy was our server and he was soooo knowledgeable about the sourcing of the ingredients and how all the flavors worked together. I highly recommend this restaurant for any foodie or gourmet meal lover.

search_results.formatted_address: 3rd Floor, 91 Mạc Thị Bưởi, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: The Monkey Gallery DINING

search_results.name: The Monkey Gallery DESSERT BAR

name: Quán Bụi
address: 222 - 224 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.text: Excellent menu variety. Definitely something for everyone. Quite an extensive wine and alcoholist as well. The food was delicious I had the shrimp in the menu it was like with chili and spicy but I asked for it just to be grilled and it was done to perfection. I just didn't expect the heads to still be on. 😮😬 So I definitely had to work to eat my dinner. I also had a passion fruit drink which was good as well. But the prices are reasonable for the Vietnam area as well. This place is recommended by my hotel and it wasn't disappointing. It was a little busy when I got there so the only drop back was I had a flag down the server to take my order and then flag down the server again at the end of my meal just to get my check and pay. They added a service charge and a tax to the menu so be prepared. I took photos of the entire menu surprises are good as of today, this posting.

The food portion and variety is amazing!  The ambiance of the place is superb.  Food is served fresh and the service is bar none!  We would like to thank Ngoc (Monique) for an amazing customer service.  She’s very knowledgeable and on things beyond the scope of her job as a waitress.  We asked for recommendations on where to shop and she delivered!  She also celebrates her birthday today.  Happy birthday!

Definitely coming back and recommending this place to my friends and family.

I am in love with this restaurant! It's absolutely beautiful and the food is so flavorful and delicious, it's my favorite restaurant in the whole of Vietnam! Its prices are so fair and we went here three days in a row. We all absolutely adore this restaurant and I recommend the beef pho soup for the kids or picky eaters and this is just the type of restaurant everyone loves. My favorite restaurant forever 🥰🥰🥰!!!

search_results.formatted_address: 222 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 222 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn

name: Saigon Pho 39
address: Đ. Đông Du/39 ward, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 71000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Saigon Pho 39 was a convenient dinner spot near our hotel, and we’re glad we tried it! Their pho and banh mi were delicious—not the absolute best we’ve had, but still authentic and satisfying. The staff may struggle with English, but their warmth and passion for service make up for it.

The restaurant is clean, the food is reasonably priced, and overall, it’s a solid choice for a comforting Vietnamese meal.

We came here quite late after having soMe beers and I am glad we did.
The food was excellent - we had pho and a Bahn mi.
Quick service and excellent prices.
Also they let us drink a beer we had brought from Heart of Darkness.

Vwry central, located in a side street. Tried their Beef Pho and was pleasantly surprised by the amount of veggies that came with it. The broth was on a sweeter side, not to my liking but others might find it tasty. Pho noodles seemed to be made from scratch but I can be wrong, however, they were tasty.  Would appriciate if there were more condiments such as garlic or chilli oil. Due to the location, the price of pho there was 2-2.5x higher than on average. One plus that they open till quiet late. Not going to be my first choice in the area but might come again if I am nearby at a late time.

search_results.formatted_address: Đ. Đông Du/39 ward, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 71000, Vietnam
search_results.name: Saigon Pho 39

plus_code.compound_code: QPG3+8V District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

name: Square One
address: 2 Công trường Lam Sơn, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: The worst restaurant I have ever been. This is not a French restaurant. They serve salty Vietnamese food and tasteless Chinese food. The meat dish was terrible. I would never visit again even they pay me to eat. Avoid it at all cost. I can’t think of any restaurant worser than this one.

The steamed grouper was tender and flavorful, and the wagyu on the stone was a true delicacy, cooked to perfection.

For dessert, the small soufflé was enough to  serve three people, a sweet end to a great meal.

I didn’t expect a common Chinese dishes (from my knowledge) on a western style restaurant’s menu, out of my expectations. And it tastes like any fast food restaurant in Hong Kong. Other than that, it is fine.

search_results.formatted_address: 2 Công trường Lam Sơn, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 2 Công trường Lam Sơn

name: Di Mai Restaurant
address: 136-138 Đ. Lê Thị Hồng Gấm, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
I had brunch at Di Mai at Le Thi Hong Gam, and it was an outstanding experience.

The atmosphere is warm, with strong Vietnamese touches, from the interior to the overall theme.

The food? Absolutely delicious. They offer set menus for 2 to 6 people, divided into North, Central, and South Vietnam, making it easy to explore regional flavors.

The staff are friendly, proactive, and fluent in English, making ordering effortless.

Highly recommended!
Tried the brand in Crescent before, first time trying in D1. Quite spacious restaurant, many foreigners, food is ok, service is good.

I’m so confused about the state of Michelin ratings in Vietnam. We went to Bep Me close by and I thought it was awful.

This restaurant isn’t Michelin rated but I feel is far superior. The only thing I disliked was the can chua was too sweet. Their jackfruit desert was really good and I recommend ordering it.

search_results.formatted_address: 136 Đ. Lê Thị Hồng Gấm, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 136 Đ. Lê Thị Hồng Gấm

name: Hidden House Restaurant
address: 55/3 Đ. Lê Thị Hồng Gấm, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Vietnamese food in a pretty alley that's not really hidden tho and pretty sure we got ripped off too

Honestly tho: What's ok about this place is the southern style heavy seasonings and dipping sauce. I enjoyed the fresh squid out all dishes, braised pork belly with shrimp is also nice, salty, umami, and sweet that go pretty well with white rice, bánh khọt (mini savory pancake) was extra crispy, though too oily for me.

The only reason we felt ripped off is the fact that the server confirmed the squid price was VND600,000/ KG and we ordered 0.5KG. Then the bill came as VND799,000 / KG. I don't mind the high price but there is a misinformation here which kinda ruining the experience.

All in all this is a decent lunch for a group setting.

Turnaround time was OK, as we waited for about 10 minutes but all of the food arrived at the same time.

My first lunch in Saigon was here, food was perfect with great ambience though Slightly hidden just like its name. Would recommend this place as they do serve authentic Vietnamese cuisine and many other food choices. Very attentive waiters to recommend food of your choice. They do serve local beers too.

WOW!! Definitely get the Pumpkin stewed with Pork and the Fried Rice with Garlic!!! All the food we ate was so delicious! Staff were friendly and spoke English. Music was cozy and it had air-conditioning and such a lovely vibe. Would definitely eat here again. An absolute must if you're in Ho Chi Minh.

search_results.formatted_address: 55/3 Đ. Lê Thị Hồng Gấm, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 55/3 Đ. Lê Thị Hồng Gấm

name: Secret Garden 2nd Branch - Vietnamese Restaurant
address: 17-19 Đ. Lê Công Kiều, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: Lovely decorated restaurant serving delicious Vietnam cuisine. The pancakes are a highlight. The fish and grilled seafood are quite nice as well. Overall a wallet friendly place with nice ambience.

HUNGER MUST HAVE

This is a hidden gem. An unassuming restaurant with great food. Don’t expect fancy but do expect good food. Food was served quickly. The prices were great and the selection of dishes was extensive. We’ve tried a number of their selection and have never been disappointed. Lovely service tho.

The décor is something to be desired.

"I recently dined at Secret Garden , and it was an unforgettable experience! The ambiance was warm and inviting, perfect for a cozy dinner. I ordered the set of rolls, which was perfectly fresh and bursting with flavor. Our server was incredibly friendly and suggested with mango salad, which was the perfect to our meal. The prices were reasonable for the quality of food and service.
I can't wait to return!"

search_results.formatted_address: 17 Đ. Lê Công Kiều, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

name: Nhà hàng Kim's
address: 118 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Family ate here. The staff were friendly and can speak English really well especially to the one who served us named Loan. The service was fast. The food was also delicious. The noodles were really good. They also gave us free noodles. Overall experience, happy and full. Will definitely recommend and come again for a quick fix.

Worst of the worst…….
Was excited to try this restaurant as I’m the craziest crab girlie. The price was extremely high compared to other local restaurants but was still happy to give it a try.

Ordered crab meat fried rice which came out relatively quickly (about 10mins) but the next two items cha-gio & thick crab soup were served after the long wait ( 30mins or so) and it was honestly the tasteless noodle soup I’ve ever eaten in my life. Instant noodles definitely have more flavour and so much cheaper and the noodle they used felt like one from instant udon packet also only a pinch of crab meat were in the soup that must be why it has no taste.

Fried spring rolls were just ok but with that price point you would expect way more as it was 95k for one small portion.

Pls save your money, I beg you go somewhere else I was also charged for 13% extra for their service.

We left feeling ripped off still hungry and sad.

제발 여기 말고 다른곳가세여 ㅠㅠ 맹맛에 게살도 거의없고요 너무 돈아까워서 눈물나여

The portion size was large and general quality and service was good. However, the price was expensive for Vietnam (probably influenced by the location) and the beef fried rice noodles dish we ordered came with several pieces of undercooked meat.

Usually, I would be fine eating raw beef but the kitchen was dirty (for example there was a swarm of ants running through the entire restaurant). For this reason I cannot give a great review.

search_results.name: 118 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn

name: Laang SaiGon Central
address: 18 Ngô Văn Năm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
This little gem is tucked away in a back street of very busy downtown Saigon. We made a booking from our hotel and they were waiting to greet us when we arrived. In a city this noisy, this is a haven of peace and tranquility to unwind in.
The drinks were quickly delivered while we made our food choices and they had such interesting dishes to choose from. None of us wanted a huge meal but there was something for everyone, whether you favoured red meat or seafood. The grilled prawn and pomelo salad was light but delicious. My husband loved his beef salad so much that he even ate and enjoyed the greens because of the dressing. All six of us thought it was the best food we had eaten in Vietnam and the service was excellent as well. Definitely worth a visit!

It's about a 4-minute walk from where we stayed, so come here.  The restaurant has a clean and good atmosphere, and the food is delicious.  Everything else was excellent, unfortunately my pork with rice was the only one that was too dry and tough.  Pamelo salad is one of the must-try foods. Definitely recommend when you at Saigon.

The menu is VERY long (60+ pages) but has a lot of photos which is great. The food was quite nice. We particularly enjoyed the pomelo and grilled prawns salad. Would definitely come back. Staff was nice.

search_results.formatted_address: 18 Đ. Ng. Văn Năm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 18 Đ. Ng. Văn Năm

name: Sài Gòn Kitchen Vina
address: 86 Đ. Nguyễn Du, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Celebrated my friend's birthday in this resto, the manager was kind enough to give us all free bottled water.
Food was good too. The shakes had a bitter aftertaste tho.
Great place to have lunch. I was sitting on the first floor, the view is nice. The food taste was great. You should try Vietnamese food here. There are many choices.

Don’t miss this restaurant! The food is delicious! The staff speaks good English and are attentive and helpful. Do try their homemade yogurt! I enjoyed their level 2 outdoor seating.

Squirrels are nearby and I chanced upon one!

search_results.formatted_address: 86 Đ. Nguyễn Du, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 86 Đ. Nguyễn Du

name: Nông Thôn Đại Việt - The Rice Restaurant
address: 131 Đ. Bùi Viện, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: After reading reviews, I was expecting a nice meal but it turned out not to be the case. Staff are lovely, location is good and there are great street vibes. However, the food was really not nice. The steak was rare rather than med rare and filled with lumps of fat. The Vietnam spring rolls had what seem to be bits of bone which I thought was my teeth crunching up. After that I stopped eating. I also noticed staff try to entice you to leave a good review in exchange for a free gift (worth $1-$2), and they stand over you and watch what you write to make sure it’s only positive. This is a biased way to review so I now understand why they have an unusually high rating for what they provide.
Definitely a good spot to eat and people watch at the same time. Food is delicious and service is. The staff are super friendly and speak English

Food & service was fantastic.
We had lobster which was amazing and our first taste of egg coffee.
This place is highly recommended.

search_results.formatted_address: 131 Đ. Bùi Viện, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 131 Đ. Bùi Viện

name: Vietnam House Restaurant
address: 93-95-97 Đ. Đồng Khởi, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: The staff were lovely & friendly, & happily seated us 30mins before afternoon closing. The beef Phò was absolutely terrific, & i’ve had hundreds of bowls around the world! The Hué Beef was really delicious, but my wife only let me have one bite. Finally, the crispy crab Nem were divine! Very reasonable prices, & lovely environment!

The restaurant was recommended as an authentic vietnamese food experience and it does live up to it. The service levels suffer a bit on account of the language barrier, but is largely good.

Of the food we tried, the abalone in appetizers stood out and so did the fried rice and the grouper fish in the mains. The fried netted lobster spring rolls and the fried soft shell crab can be given a miss. The cocktail menu is limited and the one I tried did not really impress. Would recommend sticking to wine and beer.

All in all a decent restaurant to grab dinner though on the expensive side.

This authentic restaurant is breathtaking beautiful. If you look for something sophisticated-that’s the place to be. The food is amazing, the service on point and the atmosphere is gorgeous. We had prawns, vegetarian tamarind soup , salmon, waterspinach and bean curd with warm ginger syrup for dessert. The pricing level is a bit pricey but you’ll receive an outrageous quality. A clear recommendation, we will definitely return.

search_results.formatted_address: 93-95-97 Đ. Đồng Khởi, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
search_results.name: Vietnam House Restaurant

name: Sol Kitchen & Bar
open_status: Chic spot for Latin American fare
address: 110 - 112 Lý Tự Trọng, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Beautiful and tastefully decorated space with top notched cuisine! Walked in without reservation but the assigned table was still fantastic. Had the oysters which was mouth watering and fresh and the crab chicharrón was fried to perfection with a fiery dip (take with caution! Hehe).
Go during happy hours to enjoy the wine and a selection of cocktails at 99k!

Beautiful lunch on our last day in Vietnam!   This Michelin starred restaurant.  We both had the 3 course menu & everything was top notch!  Definitely would recommend.   Wish this wasn’t our last day here or we would be back.  We stared everything and enjoyed every bite!  Best cheesecake we have ever had!  Also great drinks and happy hour prices.

Overall experience was amazing. Their drinks were good. Ribs came with tortilla and rice with a nice sauce to spice things up. Service was amazing. Ribs could be more tender but still tastes great with all the sides.

search_results.formatted_address: 110 Lý Tự Trọng, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 110 Lý Tự Trọng

name: Parkhaus Le Lai
address: 152 Đ. Lê Lai, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Parkhaus Le Lai Street is a fantastic spot to experience German cuisine right in the heart of Saigon! Located conveniently across from the park, this small but charming restaurant offers a great selection of authentic dishes paired with an impressive variety of German beers.

It was our first time trying German food, and we were pleasantly surprised—the flavors were quite enjoyable! The quality of the food, combined with the high level of attentive service, makes this place a tremendous value.

One of the highlights is their beer buffet, available on weekends or special occasions, where you can sample different German brews at a great price.

If you're looking for a cozy and unique dining experience in Saigon, Parkhaus is definitely worth a visit! 🍺🇩🇪

Nice chicken schnitzel, very big serving, with nice tomato/pepper sauce which came in a separate serving dish should you not like it, tho I would suggest larger quantity of this as quite dry without.

Really great they agreed to swap the French Fries for German Potatoes but sadly they forgot so it messed up the whole dish/evening. They tried to resolve but French Fries were cold &  by the time they served German Potatoes (which were lovely), we'd obviously eaten the schnitzel to prevent that going cold too.
Nice setting, clean with great staff & excellent service;  several people eating there with no problems noted.
Would definitely give it a go.

This is a wonderful restaurant right across from the park that specializes in German/Austrian cuisine including a large selection of German beers. I had a lentil soup and Weiner schnitzel (veal) with potato salad. All the items were fresh, delicious and generous in portion size. As someone who comes from a German (mother) and Austrian (father) background I can attest to the authenticity of my meal. The restaurant has a casual relaxed ambiance with both indoor and outdoor seating that is right across from a park. The service staff was prompt, courteous, efficient and English understanding. I highly recommend this place to those that enjoy German/Austrian food served by friendly staff in a pleasant environment.

search_results.formatted_address: 152 Đ. Lê Lai, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 152 Đ. Lê Lai

name: Tandoor Indian Restaurant
address: 39A-39B, Ngo Duc Ke Street, ward, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: Sometimes you carve for good Indian good.. most of the times you get disappointed.. Tandoor is total exception.. when you enter the place you feel you are in India.. food is very tasty.. service is awesome. They customize your spice level that’s a plus.. Totally our experience .. Must try

First time try Indian food with an excellent expression. The servants are really friendly, he could give us a great advice because we did not know what to choose in the menu.
The taste here is highly recommended for Vietnamese, not have any difficulties when touching with Indian taste.
One more plus are nice decoration and reasonable price located in 1 District.

We have such a great time at Tandoor Restaurant. Despite the minor issue with the table reservation, their prompt and sincere response was commendable. I really appreciate that.
The staff treat us very well and professionally. They always check our table in case we need any assistance. And the taste of the food was beyond expectation and they have sparked my curiosity to explore more Indian cuisine.

search_results.formatted_address: 39 Ngô Đức Kế, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam
search_results.name: 39 Ngô Đức Kế

name: Pandan Leaf Saigon Restaurant & Rooftop Bar
address: 107 Đ. Phạm Ngũ Lão, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
I have to say this restaurant is amazing - all foods are great. We have ordered 5 dishes, and they surprised us one after another. Prices are economic too. Patient staffs, good drinks too (slightly ordinary for juices). Highly recommended.

To my Hong Kong fellows: Ho L ho sik, not exp, pls come and try

Great Vibe and food! The roof top is such a great, beautiful, relaxing place to dine. Enjoying the view, the sky, and the city with the food is amazing. The restaurant has kind of a fusion style. It's mostly western cooking style but combining local ingredients and dishes. Come and enjoy the food!!!

Went for dinner, set menu, at this typical local cuisine restaurant.
Unfortunately, we were sent to the top (4th) floor, along narrow winding stairs.
So beware if you are seniors or knee issues.
This is a very popular local cuisine restaurant, and we enjoyed the food, ref pics.

name: Somtam ZAAP
address: 136 Pasteur, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
I visit this restaurant as many people review on google map. Overall for this restaurant is good and their staff is kind. Anyway, I order Somtam (main dish for Northeast of TH) but the taste is not met my expectation since I cannot feel any TH crab in this menu but their fried chicken is acceptable.

Just warning to TH people if you want to visit this restaurant to eat some food to reduce the feeling that you missed home, don’t set a high expectation like me from google review 😆

We had our first meal in ho Chi min here, we were well impressed, the fish cakes and pork shoulder were great starters, especially with their dipping sauces. The flat noodles was quite authentic. The desserts were amazing here, what a way to finish the first night in the city. The staff are friendly and the atmosphere was nice.

The taste is not authentic, admittedly, very oily. I’ve been to several Thai restaurants in Saigon, but obviously this is the worst! 🥲
Not only the food, but the restaurant is crowded with no air conditioning. 🔥The tables are close to each other.
I used to come there before but they must have changed the chef and recipe.

search_results.name: 136 Pasteur

name: Den Long - Home Cooked Vietnamese Restaurant
address: 130 Đ. Nguyễn Trãi, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
I came here for dinner. Luckily I booked since it got busy right after we showed up. The waiters spoke good English so it was easy to communicate. Menu had pictures as well.
Food portions were small and that’s a good thing since I wanted to try and variety. Price was fair. I paid 2.2 mil for about 10 dishes and a bunch of drinks. The eight of us felt full afterwards.
My favourite dish was the caramelized pork. Everything else was pretty good as well and it’s somewhat authentic. But this restaurant caters to foreigners.
If you want to experience Vietnamese home cooking, this is a good choice.

The coziness here is everything! This spot is rich in culture, and the food tastes great - like genuine Vietnamese home-cooked meals with beautiful plating. My family really enjoyed dining here. The only downside is the slow service, and it’s always very packed, so be prepared for a wait.

Saw great reviews online, so my friends and I decided to give this place a try. We ordered six of the recommended dishes from the menu — perfect portion for the three of us. Everything was delicious, especially the vegetable rolls! The skin was so smooth and bouncy — really impressive. Overall, a great dining experience. Would definitely come back again!

search_results.formatted_address: 130 Đ. Nguyễn Trãi, Phường Phạm Ngũ Lão, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

name: L'Usine Saigon Centre
address: TAKASHIMAYA L5-10, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: I enjoyed the Com Tam Pork, meat is soft and sauce is tasty, and I love the Saigon Sunrise. This is a filling and refreshing lunch. Lots of drink and food options actually. Only issue is the fried egg, doesn’t look as fresh.
A cosy café in a great central location. It’s cozy, well-decorated, and perfect for a chill meal or coffee break. Vegetarian options are available, and prices are mid-range. Rated 4.5 stars
We have a wonderful experience! The food was good! Exemplary! Isey, our server, is very attentive and accommodating. We recommend this restaurant.

name: Viet Village Restaurant ベト ビレッジ
address: 17 Đ. Đinh Tiên Hoàng, Đa Kao, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Viet Village offers a solid dining experience with generally good-quality ingredients and flavors that are balanced—not too salty or oily. The ambiance is comfortable, with plenty of spacious seating both downstairs and upstairs, making it a great spot for groups or casual meals. The staff are friendly and attentive, adding to the overall pleasant experience. Their spring rolls are a highlight—fresh, flavorful, and a must-try. The fried vermicelli with shrimp is decent, though not particularly standout. While everything is enjoyable, nothing truly amazed us, which is why we're giving it 3.5 stars. It's a reliable spot if you're looking for a comfortable, easygoing meal in HCMC.
Massively overpriced. Ordered a common banana salad. Prices were already elevated, but tax not even included. The beef was extremely fatty and half could not be eaten

Very friendly staff. Everyone was smiling and happy to chat. The food was good and very filling but just a pinch on the more expensive side compared to the area. (Thus the 1 Star deduction.) I had the pork, honey and sesame, as well as the chicken salad. The surrounding area is very walkable and good for a stroll before/after eating.

search_results.formatted_address: 17 Đ. Đinh Tiên Hoàng, Đa Kao, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 17 Đ. Đinh Tiên Hoàng

name: Poke Saigon Ly Tu Trong
address: First floor, 42 Bis Lý Tự Trọng, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Tasty food and very nice ambiance! Lots of options to build your bowl from and the girls serving were pleasant and well spoken. We would have liked some non-seafood options like chicken, beef or pork but the food was still very fresh and tasty. Bowls were a little small so an option to upsize would have been better. Overall though we had a great bite to eat and would recommend to anyone who enjoys a good poké bowl!

Incredible poke bowls! I tried the vegan tuna (I’m not actually vegan but was intrigued by it) and it was so delicious, I plan on returning to have it again! So many delicious options for toppings and great value. My friend had the salmon and loved it too. Lovely atmosphere and helpful staff. You have to walk through the alley and up the stairs to find it :)

This was my first time visiting Poke Saigon at  Ly Tu Trong st. The restaurant is located on the second floor of an old apartment building, and even though you have to walk upstairs, the experience is definitely worth it. The space inside is beautifully designed, airy, and much more spacious compared to  Nguyen Hue st. There are both indoor and outdoor seating options, so you can choose based on your preference.

The atmosphere is clean and fresh, and the staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. One of the highlights of Poke is that it’s a healthy restaurant. The portions are carefully measured and well-balanced, which makes you feel good about what you’re eating. Everything is served with attention to detail, from presentation to portion size.

The only downside I found was that they don’t serve ice with drinks, which is something I hope they’ll consider adding to the menu in the future. Overall, I had a great experience at Poke Saigon and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a delicious, healthy meal in a beautiful setting. I’d give it 9.5/10 💙

name: Tung's Restaurant - Vietnamese Cuisine & vegetarian Food
address: 230 Đ. Lê Thánh Tôn, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.text: Food was probably the best we had while we were in Vietnam! It was all so fresh and tasty. The staff were lovely and friendly and also spoke amazing English. I had the chicken pho which was unreal. Other people had the stir fried noodles as well as the sweet and sour chicken, which were super delicious. We also had a few cocktails which were so nice a refreshing. Would definitely recommend!

The food, the service and atmosphere were amazing. KT team was very helpful we ordered the Mekong delta pancake and had no idea how to put it together and they demonstrated for us. Our waiter spoke perfect English which made everything super easy. If ever in Vietnam again I will definitely be back
The waiter Dom Team was excellent, he was so polite and friendly. The food was alright and nothing special but good presentation. I like this place because everyone can speak English.

name: Hoang Yen Vietnamese Cuisine
address: 7 Ngô Đức Kế, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Amazing dining experience. Best place to try authentic Vietnamese cuisine. We were trying only sea food and they have one of the best options of sea food. The taste presentation and service all very good. The fish cake and the sea food spring roll is super special to this place and tasted awesome. Definitely recommended.

I happened to be walking around town and stopped by Hoang Yen restaurant for a meal. I had delicious stir-fried glass noodles with crab meat, stir-fried spinach with shrimp, and drank a few glasses of cold beer. I was very satisfied with the food and especially the service of the restaurant. love.
Very good Vietnam food. Each dish comes to my surprise. The tastes are simple with traditional Vietnam seasonings. Definitely coming back for more different dishes 😍

name: Jin Din Rou - Saigon Centre
address: 67 Đ. Lê Lợi, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
I can easily compare with the one across the hall, but this place has its difference.

Food 1.5-Star
2/10 Chicken Feet
I love this dish normally, just not this version. The texture is there, but the taste was not great, and as if the feet were not marinated enough to rid the unpleasant taste of chicken skin
8/10 Spicy Dumplings
Watch out! It's spicy 🌶🌶🌶 The tastes of the dumplings were good until you could not taste anything anymore 🤣
9/10 Soup Dumplings
This one is very nicely done. -1 due to the too thin skin layer. I ordered 3, 2 broke on their own when picked up. The soup, though, is very, very flavorful, absolutely well done. And, it goes so well with the provided ginger vinegar.
100/10 Egg Custard Bun
Very nicely done bun, soft with oozing filling, balance sweetness. And, creative outlook, yet, not too flashy.

Price 0.7-Star Standard (overpriced) mall food

Service 0.8-Star Attentive staff, though it can be a bit slow, depending on busy hours.

Environment 0.8-Star plenty of space, good for single diners or small groups. It can get quite busy and loud due to the mall set up.

Overall 3.8 🌟 Tried it ✅️

You must try this Taiwanese restaurant! All of their dim sums were delicious and juicy. If I have the chance to visit again, I will definitely go back. The seafood spicy dim sum was great, and the Szechuan wontons were very good as well. The Taiwanese beef noodle soup was a bit bland, but their egg tarts were fresh and incredibly tasty. The honey-glazed fried dumplings were a little too sweet for my liking. Overall, their service and food quality were excellent. I highly recommend it!

Their food is tasty and delicious, full of flavor, I liked their soup dumplings, it’s something new to me, the grilled goose was also delicious, later on I ordered some grilled duck and liver duck, both were fresh and delicious.
The meatballs wasn’t for my taste but still good, the milk tea was delicious and funny with that bear on top.
The fact that you can order your food and drinks from the iPad is really handy, I liked that.
The staff were kind and friendly, overall a very good restaurant considering it’s in a mall and mall restaurant tend to not be that good, but this felt like a very local place, definitely recommend it if you want some Japanese food.

name: Le Comptoir Bistro & Books
address: 12 Hồ Huấn Nghiệp, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: Relatively empty at 8pm when we walked in for dinner. Ordered the Barramundi and it was delicious! Skin was Crispy on the outside, flesh was moist and tasty on the inside.  We were given bread while we waited. Carbonara wasn’t that great in my opinion but my picky eater daughter finished it. Mango juice was a tad diluted, Vietnamese coffee was super strong and bitter.

Excellent atmosphere in the middle of District 1. The place has its charm but food was average. We ordered the steak which was a major disappointment, pasta was good (truffle mushroom and carbonara) and mussels and eggplant with rice. Egg coffee was very good

I would give six stars if I could. Excellent gourmet cafe. We had the banana, honey crepes and the sizzling beef and iced coffee. The food was absolutely incredible & the atmosphere and staff was very nice, professional and friendly. The price is extremely reasonable. My wife and I highly recommend this place, and we will definitely be back.

search_results.formatted_address: 12 Hồ Huấn Nghiệp, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
search_results.name: 12 Hồ Huấn Nghiệp

name: Hàng Dương Quán Q1
address: 32-34 Ngô Đức Kế, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: I had such a great experience here today, from the food to the service and atmosphere. Fresh and alive seafood is what makes this place stand out from the rest. They also have a unique style dry aged fish which was absolutely amazing and flavorful. I recommend trying the steamed egg with truffle sauce, best one I’ve had so far. Though price range is high but the experience is worth it, as the location is in district 1 with nice view so that’s understandable.

Came here to try the new dry aged fish and Wow it did not disappoint! The quality was on-par with if not better than what I’ve had in Australia. Their steamed egg with truffle is another Must try, velvety and decadent but most importantly flavourful. It’s city central location and incredible rooftop view justifies the respectable price-tag.
Will be back next time for their In-House Smoked Salmon!

This is a luxury restaurant with an extremely beautiful location right in the center of Ho Chi Minh City. This area will be very difficult to park a car.
The restaurant serves high-value seafood, besides that is a traditional Vietnamese menu. When experiencing here, I feel that the chef cooks very well, the dishes are displayed on the table are delicious and beautiful.
Guests coming here will be able to use private rooms to enjoy, there are musical instruments or karaoke systems in each room to serve when guests have a need. The service staff is very professional and is always present in the dining room to ensure the requests of guests.
The restaurant is suitable for groups of less than 20 people.

search_results.formatted_address: 32-34 Ngô Đức Kế, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

name: iBERICO - TAPAS y VINO -
address: 20A Thi Sách, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
An incredible experience in Ho Chi Minh. This restaurant stands out for its authentic Spanish flavors and excellent-quality products.

The service from the staff was exceptional: always attentive, friendly, and professional. You can tell they care about every detail to make the experience perfect.

The atmosphere and music truly transport you to Spain, creating a cozy and delightful vibe. Definitely a place to return to and recommend.

I had an amazing experience at this restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious, and the flavors were spot on. The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, making it a perfect spot to relax and enjoy a meal. What stood out the most was the incredible staff—Đức and Leo were so friendly and attentive, ensuring everything was perfect throughout our visit. I’ll definitely be coming back and highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and excellent service!

We came for Christmas and ordered some salchichon and cheese. The food was delicious, and the Xmas decorations are very cute. Our wait staff at the bar area, especially Ngan gave us excellent service and enhanced the festive mood!!

address: 1B Ngô Văn Năm, Bến Nghé, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh 70000, Vietnam

reviews.text:
Had a delightful lunch in this restaurant. Since it was for a group booking, they prepared a set menu for us. All the dishes were delightful, but the tray of grilled pork with herbs and rice noodle was my favourite.

The place has quaint decor and the service was okay. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Part of a small group od restaurants with the same name, this one being centrally located. Sizeable menu with choices from several regions throughout Vietnam. Reasonable prices for well-prepared food, and an equally reasonably priced wine and drinks list. Pleasant experience overall

Went there for lunch, they have an upstairs area with AC which is nice. Service is on point, quantities are good and quality is adapted to prices. Very extensive menu, a lot of choices. Would recommend.

name: Quince Saigon
address: 37bis Đ. Ký Con, Phường Nguyễn Thái Bình, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text:
From the moment you step into Quince in Saigon, you're enveloped in an atmosphere of understated elegance. The **beautiful decor** strikes a perfect balance between modern sophistication and warm inviting charm. But what truly sets Quince apart, beyond its aesthetic appeal, is the captivating open kitchen concept. It's a genuine pleasure to witness the culinary artistry unfold before your eyes, watching the chefs work with precision and passion, transforming fresh ingredients into exquisite dishes. This transparency adds a layer of entertainment and trust to the dining experience.

And speaking of exquisite dishes, the food at Quince is nothing short of **exceptional**. Every plate is a testament to the quality of ingredients and the skill of the kitchen team. It's easy to see why they've earned a well-deserved Michelin mention.During my visit, the bone marrow stood out as an absolute highlight – rich, flavorful, and utterly decadent. Similarly, the steak was cooked to perfection, boasting a beautiful sear and tender, juicy interior.

To elevate the meal further, Quince boasts a  vast and thoughtfully curated wine selection. Our server offered excellent recommendations, and the chosen glass paired flawlessly with both the bone marrow and the steak, creating a truly harmonious culinary experience.

Just when you think the meal couldn't get any better, Quince surprises you with a delightful candy box treat at the end. It's a whimsical and playful touch that leaves a lasting positive impression.

Overall, my experience at Quince was truly memorable. The beautiful ambiance, the captivating open kitchen, the exceptional food and drinks, and the thoughtful finishing touches all contribute to a dining experience that is both sophisticated and thoroughly enjoyable. If you're looking for a special meal in Saigon, Quince is an absolute must-visit. I wholeheartedly recommend it and can certainly see why it has garnered such well-deserved recognition.

- Restaurant: Not too spacious. Open kitchen. Primarily black decor.
- Service: Polite and attentive.
- Drinks: ordinary.
- Food: Quite delicious. Beautifully presented.
- Price: Quite high compared to the general level.
The fine dining experience was quite good. The service was polite and attentive. The food took a bit long to come out, perhaps because the restaurant was quite crowded that day. And there were some customers celebrated the birthday anniversaries at the restaurant that day.

Some culinary experiences are simply unforgettable. Quince was one of them. The moment I took a bite of their foie gras parfait (first photo) was when I started dreaming about my next visits here. Every dish was exquisite -- no flavors are wasted, they're all meticulously curated. Healthy portion so come hungry. If there's only two of you I highly recommend getting the bar seat to complement your meal watching the chefs in the zone. A beautiful experience in Saigon -- the only down side was that I was too full to try more dishes. A special mention to Harry for his top notch service.

name: The Daun Restaurant
address: 48 Đ. Lê Lai, Phường Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam

reviews.text: The spicy/ beef noodles are my favorite dishes by far! The broth tastes incredible and it’s the right amount of noodles and meat for me. I can’t explain how wonderful it tastes but this is a must have if you’re Muslim and want to try Vietnamese Halal food😍

Let’s start by saying I ate here 4 times whilst visiting HCMC. The pho is very good, as well as some of the other foods. They are fully halal and will take care of your dietary requirements (I had allergies to eggs and nuts and they catered!). Would recommend and would visit again when in the city!

We chose some healthy options - beef broth, French beans+egg, mushroom omelette & tumeric prawn (not on menu but a request that was graciously met). Lovely friendly service and yummy comfort food. Strongly recommended.
